description.narrative:
Starting from February 2021, NIRAS will be in charge of administrating seconded to the OSCE’s SMM mission in Ukraine. The purpose of this is to professionalize the administration of seconded and to ensure that the procedure is similar to seconded FSB, following MFA’s policies on postings to countries with security and health difficulties.
EUN has set a target figure for 10 seconded to OSCE’s SMM mission, of which three are managerial level positions. The selection of a Dane seconded as a team leader (in the field) or centrally placed at the head quarter in Kiev is a priority.
Key results To contribute to the OSCE’s monitoring of the parties to the Minsk-agreement to observe the ceasefire and pull-out of weaponry.
Justification for support: The Danish contribution to the SMM-mission is a part of Denmark’s membership of the OSCE and the decision made by the 57 OSCE-member states to prolong the SMM-mandate with one year.
The role of the OSCE in Ukraine is twofold: Firstly, the OSCE-leadership’s special representative is sitting at the top of the table in the Trilateral Contact Group, continually negotiating the implementation of the Minsk-agreement. Secondly, the observers from the OSCE’s Special Monitoring Mission (SMM) monitors the parties’ implementation of the Minsk-agreement on the ground in relation to the ceasefire and pull-out of weaponry.
Starting from February 2021, NIRAS will be in charge of administrating seconded to the OSCE’s SMM mission in Ukraine. The purpose of this is to professionalize the administration of seconded and to ensure that the procedure is similar to seconded FSB, following MFA’s policies on postings to countries with security and health difficulties.
EUN has set a target figure for 10 seconded to OSCE’s SMM mission, of which three are managerial level positions. The selection of a Dane seconded as a team leader (in the field) or centrally placed at the head quarter in Kiev is a priority.
Background: Secondments are a strategic and flexible instrument under the Danish Neighborhood Programme. There has been allocated a maximum of 20 million Danish kroner within the Danish Financial Act 2021 (Finansloven).
Major risks and challenges: The most significant risk continues to be the non-compliance of the Minsk-agreement, which exacerbates the security situation.
